subject: Re: [junit] Message texts
msgSnippet: We use a slightly more naive approach for the messages associated with failed assertions. We display an Expected: XXX got: YYY  construction. This way we get
messageBody:
We use a slightly more naive approach for the messages associated with
failed assertions. We display an Expected: XXX got: YYY construction.

This way we get both the fact that the assertion failed, and the cause,
which assists in the debugging. And, of course, if the tests succeed, we
don't get any excess clutter.

Jim

J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>Kevin Lawrence wrote:
>
>
>
>>I find that the stack trace gives me plenty of information to understand
>>the failure and that more text is not necessarily better.
>>
>>
>
>Yes. I prefer to let line numbers be my guide. When that's not enough,
>however, ...
>
>
>
>>Of course, if I can't find a way to make the test clearer, I'll add a
>>message to the assertion :-)
>>
>>
>
>Exactly, and we have been talking about what that message should read.
>
>
